title: spack module DB locking problem
body:
I am not successful in building spack software and loading spack built software at the same time.

I get the following error.

[b3b@service2 ~]$ spack load git
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/apps/local/spack/bin/spack", line 176, in <module>
    main()
  File "/apps/local/spack/bin/spack", line 154, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/module.py", line 107, in module
    module_find(args.module_type, args.spec)
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/module.py", line 68, in module_find
    specs = spack.installed_db.query(spec)
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 551, in query
    with self.read_transaction():
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 598, in **enter**
    if self._enter() and self._acquire_fn:
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 608, in _enter
    return self._db.lock.acquire_read(self._timeout)
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lock.py", line 103, in acquire_read
    self._lock(fcntl.LOCK_SH, timeout)   # can raise LockError.
  File "/apps/local/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lock.py", line 76, in _lock
    raise LockError("Timed out waiting for lock.")
llnl.util.lock.LockError: Timed out waiting for lock.

In this case I was building gcc@4.9.3 and at the same time trying to load git (spack load git).
This seems like a severe limitation in a multi-user environment. Is this a limitation in spack or maybe my configuration is wrong or there is an easy work-around?

Thanks,
Cormac.
